contexts.context: ...and pilgrims daily. Citizens flock to the Arena for public <mark>entertainments</mark> like mock battles and comic plays. Outlanders mostly confine themselves...
...on the east. The Arena is the site of public <mark>entertainments</mark> and combat sports. The comfortable domed Arena has seating for...
...spectators; beneath the Arena are dressing and storage rooms for <mark>entertainers</mark> and training rooms and animal pens for the combat competitors....
Master Gothren agreed to see the acrobats because he needed <mark>entertaining</mark>. For months now, he had been struggling with his fellow...
...then, but we decided that he still owed us for the <mark>entertainment</mark> we provided under torture. We weren't sure how to collect...
...the Treaty of the Armistice, and Telvanni Council will not <mark>entertain</mark> any discussion of abridgements of those rights.
